answerText: nucleus[10] Within the nucleus, DNA is wrapped around histones to form this long, stringy substance, which condenses into chromosomes during mitosis. This substance has a darker-staining "hetero" variety and a lighter "eu" variety.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 4 | 18 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Transport into this organelle is controlled by the Ran-GTP cycle.  [10] Name this enveloped organelle found in most eukaryotic cells, but no prokaryotic cells. It stores DNA.
